headline: Upbeat Outlook for Global Economy, But Low Rates Narrow Wiggle Room
abstract: Top policymakers said easing trade tensions had raised prospects, but low interest rates leave central banks few options if problems develop.
lead_paragraph: DAVOS, Switzerland â€” Top economic policymakers and business leaders from around the world made fairly upbeat predictions for global economic growth this year at the World Economic Forum on Friday, but cautioned that already low interest rates meant there was limited room to respond if new problems arose.
